intro: Nigella verrucosa, commonly known as the horned poppy, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its distinctive, spiky, orange to reddish-brown seed pods that resemble horns, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and produces delicate, cup-shaped flowers in shades of yellow to orange. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are often reddish in color. Nigella verrucosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
